item.description:
A couple of us will be watching the movie MoneyBall at the Woburn Cinema. 

Purchase your ticket and meet inside at the entrance to the MoneyBall Theatre at 12:30pm.

Start time is 12:40pm. Run time is approximately 2 hours or much shorter than your average Sox game. 

MoneyBall is NOT about how the 2011 Red Sox suffered the worst September collapse in the history of Baseball with a $165 Million Dollar payroll while players fattened up on fried chicken and beer in the club house during games. This movie will be out in about 2 years.

MoneyBall is a movie starring Brad Pitt based on the best selling book by Michael Lewis, "MoneyBall - The Art of Winning an Unfair Game" about the Oakland Athletics baseball team and its general manager Billy Beane. It focuses on the teams modernized, analytical, sabermetric approach to assembling a competitive baseball team, despite Oakland's disadvantaged revenue situation.  By re-evaluating the strategies that produce wins on the field, the 2002 Athletics, with approximately $41 Million in payroll, were competitive with larger market teams such as the New York Yankees which spent $125 Million in payroll that same year.  

We will head over to ScoreBoard next door for a bite, to watch the Pats game or a playoff game.
item.how_to_find_us: Movie starts at 12:40pm, Meet at 12:30pm at the Entrance to the MoneyBall Theatre
item.name: Watch The Movie MoneyBall at Woburn Showcase Cinema & Lunch at Scoreboard
